Vocabularies.Definition: change opinion after considering (sth.) again （重新考虑后）改变主意
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I have never had second thoughts about my decision to leave the company.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  the chance or hope that sth. will happen 前景，可能性
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We have good prospects.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.   improve further the good quality or status of 增强
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Passing the English examination should enhance your chances of getting the post.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.    made or produced as a copy of sth. natural; not real 人工的；假的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The city is dotted with many small artificial lakes.

Vocabularies.Definition: have (a particular opinion); arrange to receive a newspaper, etc. regularly by paying in advance 赞成；订阅
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Personally I subscribe to your opinion.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad. as an inevitable result; in all cases  必然地
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The fact that something is cheap doesn't necessarily mean it's of low quality.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.     disapprove of strongly 谴责
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Most people are willing to condemn violence of any sort as evil.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.    not clearly expressed or stated 模糊的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Through the fog we saw the vague outline of a ship.

Vocabularies.Definition: help  支持
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He was approached by the organizers to lend support to a benefit concert.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   expression of opposition, disapproval or dislike 反对
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. He has a strong objection to building a new trade center in such a remote area.

Vocabularies.Definition: accept (sth) unpleasant over a period of time; come to an agreement with  只好接受，顺从；与……达成协议
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  It's hard to come to terms with being unemployed.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  impossible to avoid; certain to happen 不可避免的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Such a difficult operation may not succeed; it's an inevitable gamble.

Vocabularies.Definition: be certain to 一定会
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I'll show it to Benjamin. He's bound to know.

Vocabularies.Definition: essentially; fundamentally 实质上
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The two arguments are in essence the same.

Vocabularies.Definition: (overcame; overcome) vt. get the better of; conquer 克服，征服
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We overcame a lot of difficulties.

Vocabularies.Definition: on account of; because of  由于
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She became a British citizen by virtue of marriage.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.       forbid, esp. by laws 禁止
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Smoking is prohibited in most theaters.

Vocabularies.Definition: be based on   依赖
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  His whole argument rested on false assumption.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.     of crucial importance; essential  极其重要的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Such measures are vital to national security.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  important; considerable  重要的，重大的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  It is significant for a country simply to participate in the Olympics.
